[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., "Throughout that part of the world...") impair readability.
[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unrelated paragraphs (e.g., historical figure, clothing descriptions) disrupt flow.

[LOGIC]: Illogical inclusion of unrelated historical/cultural fragments (e.g., Lt. Col. Porter, clothing).
[TRANSITION]: Sudden shifts between ideas (e.g., from religious unity to "God is Dead" rhetoric without clear links).

[SYNTAX]: Complex, lengthy sentence structures may slightly impede readability despite grammatical correctness.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unrelated paragraph ("The next morning...") disrupts logical flow and topic coherence.

[COMPLEXITY]: Overly dense and formal language may impede smooth reading for non-specialized audiences. - [SENTENCE STRUCTURE] Occasionally convoluted sentence lengths and archaic phrasing (e.g., "hath wafted").

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift to "But Adolphe cannot always stay away" without contextual integration.
[STRUCTURE]: Late introduction of Bahá'ís' role feels disconnected from preceding thematic flow.
[LOGIC]: Assumptions about religious authority and modernity could benefit from clearer logical bridges.

[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures with multiple nested clauses (e.g., quotes from Bahá'u'lláh) that slightly impede smooth reading flow.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unconnected shifts between theological discussions, descriptive art segments, historical references, and anthropological observations without transitional links.

[LEXICON]: Use of less common vocabulary (e.g., "teleological", "inimical") may slightly impede readability.
[SYNTAX]: Occasionally complex sentence structures requiring careful reading.
Overly complex, lengthy sentence structures impairing readability.

[STRUCTURE]: Slight abruptness in transitioning from theological themes to societal critiques.

[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., "Through His revelation...")
[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift in tone/content (e.g., Madame Bettina narrative disrupts philosophical flow)

[STRUCTURE]: Non-sequential ideas (e.g., Boucher/France analogy feels disconnected)
[LOGIC]: Repetitive emphasis on religion’s role without clear progression

[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., "Failure to meet the challenge...")
[LEXICON]: Occasional awkward phrasing (e.g., "the negation of the good that evil represents")

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from discussing evil to historical taxation example
[STRUCTURE]: Long, disconnected paragraphs (e.g., covenant-breaking section lacks clear introduction)
[CLARITY]: Assumes background knowledge of Bahá'í Covenant without explanation

[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., "As long and tragic experience has demonstrated...")
[LEXICON]: Occasional archaic or specialized vocabulary ("satanic fancy", "in-gathering")

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between ideas (e.g., from unity to eschatological themes)
[CLARITY]: Unintroduced quotes assume prior knowledge of Bahá'í scripture

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt introduction of dialogue without contextual setup.
